title: Riot: Talk to us on THESE Boards
body:
We have these new boards that Riot said they made for better communication with us, but where are you guys? On twitter and Reddit. Well enough! We want a one stop shop with your guys and keeping all the chatter in one place makes it all the easier for you to get the information you guys need to improve the game, and easier for us to feel like you care.

EDIT: Hint for Riot: You should be responding so it seems like you care.

How do you think devs feel? They put a years worth of work into this and Riot still won't use it.

(Great necro, guys...)

We're here.  There's a *lot* of you and very few of us, relatively.  But just know we are constantly poking each other to come hang out on social media and not sit behind our computer screens all day, regardless of how cool the thing is that we're working on...

You say that, but you should remember that it's still a bitter subject for most old timers as you guys went on and killed GD with that premise, that this would become a much better terrain and MUCH closer approach with reds. I don't want to sound sensationalist, but yeah, if it ain't Twitter or Reddit, you people just don't seem to care that much.
A lot of news goes to Reddit long before reaching us, when the point of these boards was to facilitate better communication. That feels like an issue.

Especially when Reddit is a third party site with practically instant account creation where** you don't even need to prove you have a single League game of experience behind you.**    That's an issue that they've purposefully been avoiding because of all of the white-knighting they get from the esports drones and nazi mods.

Yeah I have a CLG icon because I like watching the team, but I don't _obsess_ over esports like the zombie hivemind and their alt accounts that infest every page.  

That's the real issue - they want it to be like this.  They want to make changes and talk over Reddit because people will blindly nod their heads and smile, willing to accept the divine word of Rito Gaemz regardless of how it impacts the game. 

 They don't care because changes mean LCS will change, and if LCS changes, they have something new and exciting  to watch.  They don't care about those game-impacting decisions because I'm convinced at least half of Reddit doesn't even play; they just spectate and pretend to be a part of something they aren't.

> There's a lot of you and very few of us, relatively.

Doesn't matter. There's what... five thousand Rioters and only 5 or 6 ever dare to write on Boards?

I'll tell you the website for the best League of Legends social media in the whole internet.
[Link](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com)

c'mon man, this is big developer communication 101. You have 2 boards: a fanmade one that you go on because the community is filtered and somewhat tolerable, and the official boards that you promote so that when everyone wants to complain, they have a place to go to.

It is the only 100% sure fire way to get an actual read on a community, rather than the filtered crap that just looks for a place to bitch.

But then again, when you start hosting your AMAs and stuff on said fan board, it spoils the effect a bit.
